questions.solutionText: Spermology encompasses the study of seed morphology, characteristics and their interactions with the environment.
questions.hintText: This is where plants originated in.

questions.questionText: Which element has no neutrons in it?
questions.solutionText: Hydrogen does not contain a neutron, because its nucleus is so small.
questions.hintText: It has an atomic number of 1.

questions.questionText: What is the true color of the sky?
questions.solutionText: The sky has no true color.

questions.questionText: What are the three subatomic particles in an atom?
questions.solutionText: It is smallesr than an atom.

questions.questionText: What do you call a phenomenon where animals sleep in the summer?
questions.solutionText: Aestivation is a state of animal dormancy, similar to hibernation, although takes place in the summer.
questions.hintText: Many organisms like the snails do not find it comfortable in summer.

questions.questionText: Electrostatic precipitator is used to control the pollution of ___________.
questions.solutionText: The electrostatic precipitators are used for air pollution control.

questions.questionText: What is the instrument used to measure the force and velocity of the wind?
questions.solutionText: Anemometer is an instrument that measures wind speed and wind pressure.
questions.hintText: The term is derived from the Greek word anemos which means wind.

questions.questionText: What is the shape of our galaxy?
questions.solutionText: Our Galaxy is a spiral galaxy, which are rotating structures that are flat like a DVD when looked upon edge-on.

questions.questionText: Nuclear sizes are expressed in a unit named __________.
questions.solutionText: A Fermi is the smallest of three at 10^-15 m, also called a femtometer.
questions.hintText: It is named after the nuclear physics pioneer Enrico Fermi.

questions.solutionText: Hydrogen is the lightest element and exhibits the simplest atomic structure.
